Name: Texsun
Ingredients: 45 ml Straight rye whiskey (100 proof /50% alc./vol.)
2.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of coin-sized grapefruit zest twist (sun-like).
Review: Best made with a bottled-in-bond rye whiskey but also works well with bourbon. Depending on your whiskey and grapefruits, you may want to omit or even increase the sugar syrup. Strike the right balance and this is a refreshing bracer of an aperitif.
History: Adapted from a recipe in the 1949 edition of Esquire's Handbook for Hosts .
Nutrition: One serving of Texsun contains 156 calories
